Definition at line 32 of file coordinate_transform.h.

Member Function Documentation

bool ipl::CCoordinateTransform::ScaleAndRotateAuto (  CStdImage &    Source,
CStdImage &    Dest,
double    Sx,
double    Sy,
double    phi,
UINT32    Background
) 
 

Performes a scaling given by (Sx,Sy) and a rotation through the angle phi.

Automatic sizing is used, i.e. adjustment to the minimum size allowing the full image to be included. Works on 24 b/p images and graytone images with 1,4 or 8 b/p. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "pSource" and "pDest". Note: When "pSource" and "pDest" points to same image the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). If the provided source image has no border, the function uses the "Background" parameter to add a temporary background with the given value to do interpolation at edge-pixels fast. Adds a line to the history of Dest.

Parameters:
Source  Source image to scale.
Dest  Destination image, may be same as source image.
Sx  Scaling in x-direction.
Sy  Scaling in y-direction.
phi  Rotation in radians.
Background  If source image has no border, a temporary border with this value is added to the source image. Note: If the source image has a border the function uses the pixel values in this border to interpolate edge pixels.
Returns :
False if source image is empty.
Version:
1.00
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

Definition at line 34 of file coordinate_transform.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CStdImage::m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CCoordinateTransform::ScaleAndRotateFixed (  CStdImage &    Source,
CStdImage &    Dest,
double    x0,
double    y0,
int    Width,
int    Height,
double    Sx,
double    Sy,
double    phi,
UINT32    Background
) 
 

Makes an image with dimensions (Width * Height) and unchanged bits per pixel.

Performs a scaling (Sx,Sy) and a rotation through the angle phi. The position (x0,y0) of the old image is placed at (Width/2,Height/2) in the new. Works on 24 b/p images and graytone images with 1,4 or 8 b/p. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "pSource" and "pDest". Note: When "pSource" and "pDest" points to same image the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). If the provided source image has no border, the function uses the "Background" parameter to add a temporary background with the given value to do interpolation at edge-pixels fast. Adds a line to the history of Dest.

Parameters:
Source  Source image to scale.
Dest  Destination image, may be same as source image.
x0  Horisontal position from old image placed at Width/2 in new image.
y0  Vertical position from old image placed at Height/2 in new image.
Width  Size in horisontal direction of new image.
Height  Size in vertical direction of new image.
Sx  Scaling in x-direction.
Sy  Scaling in y-direction.
phi  Rotation in radians.
Background  If source image has no border, a temporary border with this value is added to the source image. Note: If the source image has a border the function uses the pixel values in this border to interpolate edge pixels.
Returns :
False if source image is empty.
Version:
1.00
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

Definition at line 65 of file coordinate_transform.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CStdImage::m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

bool ipl::CCoordinateTransform::ScaleAuto (  CStdImage &    Source,
CStdImage &    Dest,
double    Sx,
double    Sy,
UINT32    Background
) 
 

Performs a scaling using the scale factors (Sx,Sy) and autosizing of the new image placed in "Dest".

Works on 24 b/p images and graytone images with 1,4 or 8 b/p. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "Source" and "Dest". Note: When "Source" and "Dest" points to same image the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). If the provided source image has no border, the function uses the "Background" parameter to add a temporary background with the given value to do interpolation at edge-pixels fast. Adds a line to the history of Dest.

Parameters:
Source  Source image to scale.
Dest  Destination image, may be same as source image.
Sx  Scaling in x-direction.
Sy  Scaling in y-direction.
Background  If source image has no border, a temporary border with this value is added to the source image. Note: If the source image has a border the function uses the pixel values in this border to interpolate edge pixels.
Returns :
False if source image is empty.
Version:
1.00
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)

int    Width,
int    Height,
double    Sx,

Makes an image with dimensions (Width * Height).and unchanged bits per pixel.

Performs a scaling (Sx,Sy). The position (x0,y0) of the old image is placed at (Width/2,Height/2) in the new. Works on 24 b/p images and graytone images with 1,4 or 8 b/p. If you want the resulting image placed in the source image just use the same pointer for both parameters "pSource" and "pDest". Note: When "pSource" and "pDest" points to same image the function is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary image to the destination). If the provided source image has no border, the function uses the "Background" parameter to add a temporary background with the given value to do interpolation at edge-pixels fast. Adds a line to the history of Dest.

Parameters:
Source  Source image to scale.
Dest  Destination image, may be same as source image.
x0  Horisontal position from old image placed at Width/2 in new image.
y0  Vertical position from old image placed at Height/2 in new image.
Width  Size in horisontal direction of new image.
Height  Size in vertical direction of new image.
Sx  Scaling in x-direction.
Sy  Scaling in y-direction.
Background  If source image has no border, a temporary border with this value is added to the source image. Note: If the source image has a border the function uses the pixel values in this border to interpolate edge pixels.
Returns :
False if source image is empty.
